COMMENT_TX: $First game at Target Field, Minneapolis

replay,5,camem001,BOS,tscht901,MIN04,F,N,I,,H $Mike Cameron hit a fly ball down the LF line that went between the pole and the limestone facing of the stands; it was ruled a foul ball by 3B umpire Kerwin Danley; Red Sox manager Terry Francona asked about the ruling, so crew chief Tim Tschida looked at the replay and upheld the call; the gap between the pole and the wall is very narrow; first replay in the fifth inning of the first game in the park
$after the throw to the plate Red Sox catcher Victor Martinez threw to 2B attempting to put out Denard Span; Nick Punto, who had stopped at 3B, scored on the throw to 2B

$catcher Lou Marson retrieved the ball after the wild pitch and threw it in the dirt to pitcher Justin Masterson, who was covering the plate; Delmon Young rounded 3B and scored when the ball got away from Masterson

replay,5,keara001,CLE,tscht901,MIN04,O,N,I,,H $Austin Kearns' fly hit the top of the wall and bounced back onto the field; the Indians asked about the call so crew chief Tim Tschida watched the replay and upheld the call
fan interference
Tigers catcher Gerald Laird left the game due to an injured leg
$Twins shortstop J.J. Hardy made a diving stop in the hole and had no chance to get the batter; Alex Avila rounded 3B too far and Hardy threw to 3B Nick Punto to catch Avila
Tigers left fielder Johnny Damon left the game due to an injured leg

$ball four to Matt Wieters rolled away from catcher Wilson Ramos; HP umpire Ted Barrett handed Ramos a new ball, although the other ball was still live; Ramos tried to give it back but Barrett called time to prevent a problem
Debut game for Trevor Plouffe
Debut game for Jonathan Lucroy
Brewers second baseman Joe Inglett left the game due to an injured ankle
Twins second baseman Orlando Hudson left the game due to an injured elbow
Debut game for Zach Braddock
Twins center fielder Denard Span left the game due to an injured shoulder
suspended,20100526,MIN04,rain $After rain delay of 1:23, game suspended until next day

replay,4,kinsi001,TEX,gormb901,MIN04,F,Y,I,,H $Ian Kinsler's fly down the LF line was just foul but called a home run; the Twins asked about the play so crew chief Brian Gorman watched the replay and overturned the call

replay,3,yound003,MIN,gormb901,MIN04,F,N,I,,H $Delmon Young hit the 1-1 pitch down the RF line; the ball hit on the top of the wall about 2 feet foul and was called foul; the Twins asked about the call so crew chief Brian Gorman looked at the replay and upheld the call
Rangers pitcher Derek Holland left the game due to an injured shoulder

$Denard Span ran from 2B towards 3B without tagging up; Nick Punto, who was part way to the plate, turned and yelled to Span to go back to 2B; Punto trotted towards the plate, thinking that his run would not count because the third out was going to be made at 2B; however, if he had crossed the plate before the out at 2B, his run would count; after the game, he admitted to not knowing the rule
Braves second baseman Omar Infante left the game due to an injured foot
$the pitch deflected off Ryan Spilborghs and hit HP umpire Jerry Crawford on the right foot; the Twins trainer checked him before the game resumed

$the pitch deflected off Brad Hawpe and hit HP umpire Jerry Crawford on the left shoulder; the Twins trainer checked Crawford again; Crawford took a few minutes to recover; Twins catcher Drew Butera talked with Crawford, who patted Butera on the back before they resumed
Twins pitcher Kevin Slowey left the game due to an injured ankle

ej,gardr001,M,marqa901,Call at 3B on missed tag $Kelly Shoppach ran to 3B on the single to LF; Delmon Young's throw beat Shoppach by at least eight steps; Shoppach stopped running so Michael Cuddyer moved over and tagged Shoppach, or so he thought; Shoppach ran to 3B and said something to 3B umpire Alfonso Marquez about no tag; Marquez called Shoppach safe; Twins manager Ron Gardenhire argued the call and was ejected by Marquez
White Sox right fielder Carlos Quentin left the game due to an injured hand
Indians left fielder Austin Kearns left the game due to an injured knee

replay,4,yound003,MIN,demud901,MIN04,O,N,I,,H $Indians left fielder Trevor Crowe jumped at the wall attempting to catch Delmon Young's fly ball; it hit his glove and bounced off the wall then came back down where Crowe caught it and immediately threw to the infield; it was ruled no catch; the Twins asked if it was over the wall, so the umpires huddled and crew chief Dana DeMuth watched the replay and upheld the call
Debut game for Anthony Slama

replay,5,casia001,MIN,hallt901,MIN04,O,Y,I,,H $Alexi Casilla's fly ball hit the top of the wall and caromed off the metal railing behind the flower bed; the ball bounced back onto the field and was ruled in play; Casilla stopped at third; the Twins asked about the call so crew chief Tom Hallion watched the replay and overturned the call to a home run

replay,2,wilsj003,SEA,hallt901,MIN04,F,N,I,,H $Josh Wilson golfed the ball down the left field line just foul; the Mariners asked about the call, so crew chief Tom Hallion watched the replay and upheld the call
fan interference
Twins pitcher Kevin Slowey left the game due to an injured arm
Twins pitcher Ron Mahay left the game due to an injured shoulder
Debut game for Jordan Walden

replay,2,jacka001,DET,westj901,MIN04,O,N,I,,H $Austin Jackson's fly hit the top of the wall in left center and caromed back onto the field; left fielder Delmon Young played it as if it were a home run and there was no play at third on Jackson; the ball was ruled in play; Tigers manager Jim Leyland asked about the ruling so crew chief Joe West watched the replay and upheld the call
Twins pitcher Scott Baker left the game due to an injured elbow
second baseman dropped throw at second and runner continued to third
Tigers first baseman Miguel Cabrera left the game due to an injured shoulder

ej,gardr001,M,westj901,Call at 2B $Twins second baseman Alexi Casilla took the throw and appeared to be pulling the ball out of his glove when he dropped it; 2B umpire Joe West called Austin Jackson safe at second on the play; Twins Manager Ron Gardenhire vehemently argued the ruling and was ejected by West
Debut game for Matt Fox
Twins third baseman Danny Valencia left the game due to an injured leg
Rangers designated hitter Josh Hamilton left the game due to an injured back
Rangers shortstop Elvis Andrus left the game due to an injured leg
$Jim Thome's 584th career homer to pass Mark McGwire for ninth place
Debut game for Rob Delaney

$Michael Young rounded 3B on the grounder up the middle; Orlando Hudson threw behind Young at 3B; as Young rounded the bag, he appeared to make contact with 3B coach Dave Anderson's extended arm; Young was called out due to the coach's interference
Royals first baseman Billy Butler left the game due to an injured hand
$Jim Thome's 586th homer to tie Frank Robinson for eighth place
Debut game for Ben Revere
Debut game for Jarrod Dyson
DWS: last two plays really one, but must be split for now

ej,gardr001,M,hirsj901,Call on fly ball $center fielder Rajai Davis caught and dropped the ball; the play was ruled no catch, so Delmon Young ran to second; 2B umpire John Hirschbeck then ruled that it was a catch; since the Athletics tagged Young, he was out as well; Twins Manager Ron Gardenhire argued the decision for a while and was ejected by Hirschbeck
Twins catcher Joe Mauer left the game due to an injured knee
Indians shortstop Asdrubal Cabrera left the game due to an injured hand
Twins Jason Kubel left the game due to an injured foot
